intro: Cephaelis densinervia, commonly known as the dense-veined celandine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Cephaelis densinervia is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its traditional medicinal uses in local herbal practices.
